Sentece: Peak effects on all measurements were observed at 1 h and coincided with peak plasma concentrations: QS2c shortened by 36 +/- 13 ms (mean +/- SD; p less than 0.01 compared to placebo); arterial blood flow increased from 2.10 +/- 0.58 to 4.32 +/- 1.26 ml 100 ml-1 min-1 (mean +/- SD; p less than 0.01 compared to placebo); norepinephrine dose-response curves shifted to the right (p less than 0.01 with 20-320 ng/min compared to baseline), i.e., to achieve the same vasoconstriction as before enoximone a 3-to-5-times higher dose of norepinephrine was needed.
